item.title: ShareStats started!
item.description: The ShareStats project started on September 1, 2020. The project runs for 2 years and is funded by SURF and the participating universities.
Question In an experiment, a standard ANCOVA analysis investigates the effect of Social Stress (Two-group Factor: $Z_1$) on Performance (Dependent Variable: $y$).

item.title: Dimitris Pavlopoulos
item.description: Together with Marike I will coordinate the quality control. Our goal is to collect a rich set of questions that can be applied directly to education of Methods and Statistics.

item.title: Joran Jongerling
item.description: I hope to be able to offer enough (high quality) questions to students, so they can finally practice enough to fully understand it.

item.title: Kirsten Namesnik-Silvester
item.description: It will be really nice if we can initiate a good collaboration. It is wastful to re-invent the wheel.

item.title: Lidia Arends
item.description: For years we have been trying to come up with fun, new, original statistics questions at all kinds of study programs and universities.

item.title: Marike Polak
item.description: Together with Dimitris I coordinate the review and revision of statistical statements. With this we ensure that the already available assignments of all participating universities are drawn up in accordance with agreed quality requirements and can be included in the freely accessible item bank.

item.title: Marleen de Moor
item.description: As the general project leader of ShareStats I will be responsible for the planning and progress of the project.

item.title: Niels Smits
item.description: In this project I mainly focus on writing R code to extend the functionality of the exams package.

item.title: Sharon Klinkenberg
item.description: As chairman of SURF’s special interest group for digital assessments, I have seen over the past 10 years how difficult it is to share assessment items.
